text: In this mutant, expression of the spoIIG gene, whose transcription depends on both sigma(A) and the phosphorylated Spo0A protein, Spo0A~P, a major transcription factor during early stages of sporulation, was greatly reduced at 43 degrees C.
text_with_entity_marker: In this mutant, expression of the spoIIG gene, whose transcription depends on both [E1]sigma(A)[/E1] and the phosphorylated [E2]Spo0A[/E2] protein, Spo0A~P, a major transcription factor during early stages of sporulation, was greatly reduced at 43 degrees C.

text: In this mutant, expression of the spoIIG gene, whose transcription depends on both sigma(A) and the phosphorylated Spo0A protein, Spo0A~P, a major transcription factor during early stages of sporulation, was greatly reduced at 43 degrees C.
text_with_entity_marker: In this mutant, expression of the [E1]spoIIG[/E1] gene, whose transcription depends on both [E2]sigma(A)[/E2] and the phosphorylated Spo0A protein, Spo0A~P, a major transcription factor during early stages of sporulation, was greatly reduced at 43 degrees C.

text: Analysis of the expression of a translational ywhE-lacZ fusion showed that ywhE expression is sporulation-specific, and is controlled predominantly by the forespore-specific sigma factor sigma(F), and to a lesser extent by sigma(G).
text_with_entity_marker: Analysis of the expression of a translational ywhE-lacZ fusion showed that ywhE expression is sporulation-specific, and is controlled predominantly by the forespore-specific sigma factor [E1]sigma(F)[/E1], and to a lesser extent by [E2]sigma(G)[/E2].

text: In the shaA mutant, sigma(H)-dependent expression of spo0A and spoVG at an early stage of sporulation was sensitive to external NaCl.
text_with_entity_marker: In the shaA mutant, [E1]sigma(H)[/E1]-dependent expression of [E2]spo0A[/E2] and spoVG at an early stage of sporulation was sensitive to external NaCl.

text: The rocG gene of Bacillus subtilis, encoding a catabolic glutamate dehydrogenase, is transcribed by SigL-containing RNA polymerase and requires for its expression RocR, a member of the NtrC/NifA family of proteins that bind to enhancer-like elements, called upstream activating sequences (UAS).
text_with_entity_marker: The [E1]rocG[/E1] gene of Bacillus subtilis, encoding a catabolic glutamate dehydrogenase, is transcribed by SigL-containing RNA polymerase and requires for its expression [E2]RocR[/E2], a member of the NtrC/NifA family of proteins that bind to enhancer-like elements, called upstream activating sequences (UAS).

text: Unlike the case for other sigma(54)-dependent genes, rocG has no UAS; instead, its expression depends on a sequence located 1.5 kilobases downstream of the rocG promoter, beyond the end of the rocG coding region.
text_with_entity_marker: Unlike the case for other [E1]sigma(54)[/E1]-dependent genes, [E2]rocG[/E2] has no UAS; instead, its expression depends on a sequence located 1.5 kilobases downstream of the rocG promoter, beyond the end of the rocG coding region.

text: Northern blot and primer extension analyses indicated that yfhS is transcribed by E sigma E during sporulation.
text_with_entity_marker: Northern blot and primer extension analyses indicated that [E1]yfhS[/E1] is transcribed by [E2]E sigma E[/E2] during sporulation.

text: The ald promoter, like the sigE promoter, is believed to be recognized by sigmaA RNA polymerase, suggesting that sigmaK may inhibit sigmaA activity late in sporulation.
text_with_entity_marker: The [E1]ald[/E1] promoter, like the sigE promoter, is believed to be recognized by sigmaA RNA polymerase, suggesting that [E2]sigmaK[/E2] may inhibit sigmaA activity late in sporulation.

text: The first stage, which involves the phosphatase function of SpoIIE, depends on the cell division protein FtsZ and could correspond to the FtsZ-dependent assembly of SpoIIE into E-rings.
text_with_entity_marker: The first stage, which involves the phosphatase function of SpoIIE, depends on the cell division protein [E1]FtsZ[/E1] and could correspond to the [E2]FtsZ[/E2]-dependent assembly of SpoIIE into E-rings.

text: Evidence based on the use of modified and mutant forms of the phosphatase protein indicates that SpoIIE blocks the capacity of unphosphorylated SpoIIAA to activate sigmaF until formation of the polar septum is completed.
text_with_entity_marker: Evidence based on the use of modified and mutant forms of the phosphatase protein indicates that SpoIIE blocks the capacity of unphosphorylated [E1]SpoIIAA[/E1] to activate [E2]sigmaF[/E2] until formation of the polar septum is completed.

text: These results demonstrate that sigmaK-dependent transcription of gerE initiates a negative feedback loop in which GerE acts as a repressor to limit production of sigmaK.
text_with_entity_marker: These results demonstrate that sigmaK-dependent transcription of gerE initiates a negative feedback loop in which [E1]GerE[/E1] acts as a repressor to limit production of [E2]sigmaK[/E2].

text: A low level of GerE activated transcription of cotD by sigmaK RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of GerE repressed cotD transcription.
text_with_entity_marker: A low level of [E1]GerE[/E1] activated transcription of cotD by [E2]sigmaK[/E2] RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of GerE repressed cotD transcription.

text: A low level of GerE activated transcription of cotD by sigmaK RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of GerE repressed cotD transcription.
text_with_entity_marker: A low level of [E1]GerE[/E1] activated transcription of [E2]cotD[/E2] by sigmaK RNA polymerase in vitro, but a higher level of GerE repressed cotD transcription.

text: Here, we show that GerE binds near the sigK transcriptional start site, to act as a repressor.
text_with_entity_marker: Here, we show that [E1]GerE[/E1] binds near the [E2]sigK[/E2] transcriptional start site, to act as a repressor.

text: In contrast, sspJ is transcribed in the forespore compartment by RNA polymerase with the forespore-specific sigmaG and appears to give a monocistronic transcript.
text_with_entity_marker: In contrast, [E1]sspJ[/E1] is transcribed in the forespore compartment by RNA polymerase with the forespore-specific [E2]sigmaG[/E2] and appears to give a monocistronic transcript.

text: ComK negatively controls the transcription of hag by stimulating the transcription of comF-flgM, thereby increasing the production of the FlgM antisigma factor that inhibits sigmaD activity.
text_with_entity_marker: [E1]ComK[/E1] negatively controls the transcription of hag by stimulating the transcription of comF-flgM, thereby increasing the production of the [E2]FlgM[/E2] antisigma factor that inhibits sigmaD activity.

text: From these results we conclude that ComK negatively regulates degR expression by preventing sigmaD-driven transcription of degR, possibly through interaction with the control region.
text_with_entity_marker: From these results we conclude that [E1]ComK[/E1] negatively regulates [E2]degR[/E2] expression by preventing sigmaD-driven transcription of degR, possibly through interaction with the control region.

text: We have shown previously that the transcription of degR is driven by an alternative sigma factor, sigmaD.
text_with_entity_marker: We have shown previously that the transcription of [E1]degR[/E1] is driven by an alternative sigma factor, [E2]sigmaD[/E2].

text: Transcription of the cotB, cotC, and cotX genes by final sigma(K) RNA polymerase is activated by a small, DNA-binding protein called GerE.
text_with_entity_marker: Transcription of the cotB, [E1]cotC[/E1], and cotX genes by final [E2]sigma(K)[/E2] RNA polymerase is activated by a small, DNA-binding protein called GerE.

text: The sigmaB-dependent promoter drives expression of yvyD under stress conditions and after glucose starvation, whereas a sigmaH-dependent promoter is responsible for yvyD transcription following amino acid limitation.
text_with_entity_marker: The sigmaB-dependent promoter drives expression of [E1]yvyD[/E1] under stress conditions and after glucose starvation, whereas a sigmaH-dependent promoter is responsible for [E2]yvyD[/E2] transcription following amino acid limitation.

text: Therefore, ftsY is solely expressed during sporulation from a sigma(K)- and GerE-controlled promoter that is located immediately upstream of ftsY inside the smc gene.

text: The addition of ClpX to in vitro transcription reactions resulted in the stimulation of RNAP holoenzyme activity, but sigmaH-RNAP was observed to be more sensitive to ClpX-dependent stimulation than sigmaA-RNAP.

text: The class includes AsiA form bacteriophage T4, which inhibits Escherichia coli sigma 70; FlgM, present in both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, which inhibits the flagella sigma factor sigma 28; SpoIIAB, which inhibits the sporulation-specific sigma factor, sigma F and sigma G, of Bacillus subtilis; RbsW of B. subtilis, which inhibits stress response sigma factor sigma B; and DnaK, a general regulator of the heat shock response, which in bacteria inhibits the heat shock sigma factor sigma 32.
text_with_entity_marker: The class includes AsiA form bacteriophage T4, which inhibits Escherichia coli sigma 70; FlgM, present in both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, which inhibits the flagella sigma factor sigma 28; [E1]SpoIIAB[/E1], which inhibits the sporulation-specific sigma factor, sigma F and sigma G, of Bacillus subtilis; [E2]RbsW[/E2] of B. subtilis, which inhibits stress response sigma factor sigma B; and DnaK, a general regulator of the heat shock response, which in bacteria inhibits the heat shock sigma factor sigma 32.

text: The sspH and sspL genes are recognized primarily by the forespore-specific sigma factor for RNA polymerase, sigmaG; the sspN-tlp operon is recognized equally well by sigmaG and the other forespore-specific sigma factor, sigmaF.

text: The sigma W regulon includes a penicillin binding protein (PBP4*) and a co-transcribed amino acid racemase (RacX), homologues of signal peptide peptidase (YteI), flotillin (YuaG), ABC transporters (YknXYZ), non-haem bromoperoxidase (YdjP), epoxide hydrolase (YfhM) and three small peptides with structural similarities to bacteriocin precursor polypeptides.
text_with_entity_marker: The [E1]sigma W[/E1] regulon includes a penicillin binding protein (PBP4*) and a co-transcribed amino acid racemase (RacX), homologues of signal peptide peptidase (YteI), flotillin (YuaG), ABC transporters ([E2]YknXYZ[/E2]), non-haem bromoperoxidase (YdjP), epoxide hydrolase (YfhM) and three small peptides with structural similarities to bacteriocin precursor polypeptides.
